thread.title: Youngest trans-Tasman sailor sets sights on Atlantic Ocean
thread.title_full: Youngest trans-Tasman sailor sets sights on Atlantic Ocean

author: Hugh Collins
title: Youngest trans-Tasman sailor sets sights on Atlantic Ocean
text:
Youngest trans-Tasman sailor sets sights on Atlantic Ocean HUGH COLLINS Last updated 09:08, October 1 2015 SUELLEN HURLING / SUPPLIED 
Cory McLennan, 21, has the Atlantic in his sights. 
There's no time to be lonely when sailing solo. 
Accomplished Auckland sailor Cory McLennan learned this a long time ago. 
In 2014 the then 19-year-old became the youngest person to sail solo across the Tasman Sea. 
The Hillsborough resident admits his choice of sport is unusual considering he comes from a dairy farming background on the West Coast of the South Island. 
Born and raised in the Greymouth area, he became interested in the idea of sailing after he was told he had to read a book on a family holiday. 
He chose one about Sir Peter Blake. 
"On my holiday I read that book and got home and said: 'Mum I want to start sailing'." 
Since then he's slowly worked his way up through the boat classes by learning to sail on Lake Brunner, near Greymouth. 
At 16 he got his first taste of offshore sailing by joining a crew on route to New Zealand from Fiji. 
On that trip he encountered 10-metre swells. Ad Feedback 
Despite that experience he describes offshore sailing as "pretty infectious". 
Being the youngest to cross the Tasman was not without trouble. His autopilot, an essential aspect of solo sailing, failed 200 miles off the coast of New Zealand. 
Yet he still made it to Mooloolaba on the Sunshine Coast 10 days later. 
"Solo sailing, everyone thinks is quite lonely. Realistically you don't have time to worry about being alone. You just get into a routine." 
McLennan has purchased a new yacht from France which he'll use to achieve his next dream - to race solo across the Atlantic in the Mini Transat 6.50. 
Despite people telling him it's mad to cross it alone, McLennan will dedicate the next four years to achieving this goal. 
"I've got one shot at life and if you"ve got a dream you've got to try and make it happen. No one's going to give you a handout and say 'here you go, make your dream happen'." 
Search for Cory McLennan Racing on Facebook to follow his progress and vote for him to win an AMP scholarship. - Stuff
